page.title: 14THE FARM LANDSCAPE
page.content: In the last twenty-five years the changes which have taken place in British Farming have been so rapid and so striking that they have been referred to as an "agricultural revolution".There has been a large extension of crop farming; on the heavy clay soils where more powerful machines are able to plough the land. These were originally under permanant grassland. There has been a tremendous expansion in the use of fertilisers and insecticides. Vast quantities of chemicals are put into the soil to increase yields and keep down weeds. Plants are sprayed from the air against diseases. Improved methods of handling and marketing farm produce have been developed. Another trend in marketing is the increased importance of the frozen foods industry.
